comment: Couldn't be more disorganized, unclear, ambiguous, or absent-minded if he TRIED! Forgot to do things for our group for WEEKS! Despite multiple emails! Emailed our group, on the LAST DAY OF FINALS, to request changes and updates to our final report and presentation. I wish I had delayed graduation by a whole semester rather than take him. STAY AWAY!
rating_tags: So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Poor overall. Provides no feedback and is incredibly disrespectful to students. Disorganized to the point where no one was sure of any due dates, and sprung a new one via email the day before it was due. Also took forever to provide any grading, so no one was sure how they were doing the entire class, or if they would need to repeat it or not.

Be wary of his homework due dates. Assigns a lot of homework but graded by completion. His tests aren't too horrible as long as you pay attention to detail very carefully. Read the textbook a lot as he gives test questions based off slightly harder textbook examples. Write out as much work as you can and know your formulas for sure.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He lets you know what is required for your project in terms of expectations for what your senior design should be about. There are rubrics for the report, presentation, and what you are expected to talk about. No confusion on what you're graded on. He's very open, friendly, and hilarious with the feedback he gives you on the project.

Prof. Atiqullah is interactive with his class, talking to students and being very responsive to emails he gets. The class itself can get tiring, and his mike is old, so pay attention or use recordings. Tests and quizzes are also tricky and originally, we had very limited time to do them, plus the homework and report made it a tight summer class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He is very smart, a good professor. Sometimes his test and quizzes are difficult but for the most part everything is straight forward. Very nice guy.

don't take him, he will make you dislike machine design. His tests are full of errors that he admits to and simply disregards them. I am sure he is a decent guy but it's kinda horrible when he simply is unprepared and the students take the fall for him. unless he adds a curve at the end never ever TAKE HIM

If you want to learn how to become an engineer and not just get the degree, take him. *Grades based on how you approach problems. Still gives credit If you write down the correct equations and made a simple miscalculation in the process. *Taken him 4 times, by far the most enjoyable lectures. Heavy notes. *Know your formula sheets. Do the hw.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class had an absurd amount of work. The professor was unresponsive to student feedback about material on assessments not reflecting the material covered in lectures. Additionally, he clearly struggles to use technology, and we were expected to scan, upload, and e-mail him every assignment.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This will be the most unorganized teachers you'll ever take.

Atiqullah is a nice guy, but I'm surprised he is still teaching. Specifically for senior design is has been frustrating communicating our project idea with him and also receiving feedback and next steps from him. He's not a horrible professor, but I would take SD with another teacher if possible

He is a kind, respectful, approachable, and funny man. However, do not take him for Senior Design. He will approve projects just because, and gives very little feedback. My team and I had to go through the dumpster fire that is re-doing ALL the work he approved on SD1 in a weekend because of his poor mentorship.

VERY bad. He extended classes to almost an hour to complete his lectures, assigned tons of homework but would never pick it up and then still administer failing grades. Above all if your struggling quizzes and tests the best he'll say is your not reading the book hard enough even though the material he tests is levels above the actual class. BEWARE
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: He grades very rough, not a fun professor. Probably one of the hardest in the ME department and his lectures are not clear. Also his handwriting is very bad.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: 60% of class is failing. Gives HW, then completely changes the concepts for the quiz/test, makes you do extra steps that "should be easy from strengths of materials", that weren't on the HW. HW takes hours unless u use "other methods". Overall hardest class at KSU for ME's. But he is the better of the other professors for MD . Very fair grader.

Don't get aggravated if he shows up a little late, or seems a little unorganized. He is a fantastic Materials teacher. Hang around after class is over and chat with him for a minute. Before long, you'll be stopping by his office, just to chat with him. Really good sense of humor, but you have to paying attention or you'll miss it!

Do NOT take for Machine Design !!! This is the "bread and butter" of mechanical engineers and this idiot has no idea how to teach it. He spent 3/4 of the semester covering 1/4 of the material and then just rushed through the rest like it was a review of something we already know. I would take a gunshot to the leg before I take him again !
Disorganized, routinely late, has another professor proctor quizzes/tests without warning. Does not communicate until last minute.
Professor Atiqullah is an easy teacher and very nice guy. I can only speak for ENGR 2501, but i would highly suggest you take him for this class if you have the option.

As others have said, he can be late and does give long homework assignments and can be late grading them. But he is nice, knowledgeable, and grades fairly. Likes class participation. I've had him for two classes and would recommend him.

Comes across as very unorganized: Waits until absolute last minute to relay critical course material. Very hard to contact for questions. Consistently 10+ minutes late to quizzes and exams. Seems to be a very nice and knowledgeable person outside of class...maybe excessive work load is effecting in class teaching?

Comes to class unprepared most of the time.  Unable to answer student's questions in class.  Tests/Quizzes are impossible to finish during given time.  Gives HW and test material prep 2 days before at most.  Do not recommend taking this professor at all.   Very knowledgable professor outside of class though, but do not expect an A in his class.

Good with lectures, but tests and quizzes are impossible to complete in the given time. Long homeworks are typically given the day before they are due. Reliability on getting study materials in a reasonable time is minimal.

I enjoy him as a teacher. I understand the way he teaches. He is able to make boring subjects interesting. However, he was late to class EVERY day. He got behind in preparations and grading which hurt the class. Overall he is a good professor but he is anything but easy.

Very tough teacher. I've had him for two classes so far and I'm not sure how I've passed. Make sure you do the hw! Test and quizzes are tough if you don't. Like everyone else said, he's always late and never prepared for class. If you go to his office and talk to him and he gets to know you, he turns out to be a pretty cool person.

If I could take someone else I would. He's never prepared and always late. Also, I've turned in 8 report as of today and have only gotten one back graded. His speech is understandable, but very choppy. His tests are mostly trick questions or questions about random facts in the book. One test had a question from a chapter we hadn't even covered yet.
Great teacher and very helpful, nice guy. Test are semi hard though, be sure to do the homework and study the examples on the book. Little details in the book will be in the test.
He was never prepared for lecture. He would show up to class at least 15 min. late at times. Do well on the homework and the quizes, and the test should be manageable.

Unfortunately only Prof at SPSU teaching ENGR MATLs so you will have to take him. Bright spots medium to easy exams, willing to help students and flexible with due dates. Bad, disorganized, relied on powerpoint way too much. Read text book and you will do fine. Labs really bad need to be overhauled (not Profs fault though schools fault)
No Comments

His teaching style is horrible, his power point is exactly from the book.  He doesn't even know anything more than the book.  So if you do something right but in a way he doesn't know than it's wrong.  The only good thing is that you can argue with him about your grade on tests and get some points back.
Very nice guy, needs to focus on doing more examples than relying on powerpoint that goes along with book. After he gets used to being here will probably be great.
